snippet: Park Geun-hye and Moon Jae-in, the top candidates in the South Korean presidential election, say they would take a softer approach toward North Korea than the departing president.
abstract: Park Geun-hye and Moon Jae-in, top candidates in South Korea's presidential election, both say they would take softer approach toward North Korea than departing Pres Lee Myung-bak; some officials in Washington worry that moderate policies proposed by candidates could create discord as United States seeks to impose more sanctions on North Korea.

byline.contributor: David E. Sanger contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Park Geun-hye and Moon Jae-in, the top candidates in the South Korean presidential election, say they would take a softer approach toward North Korea than the departing president.

headline.seo: With South Korean Election, Policy Toward North Will Change
headline.main: South Korea Vote Will Change Policy Toward North
headline.print_headline: South Korea Vote Will Change Policy Toward North

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
